title: Establishment of the Climate Change Support Office

enrichment.summary: This order creates a temporary office within the State Department called the Climate Change Support Office to help coordinate and advance U.S. efforts on international climate change diplomacy. The office supports engagement with other countries and agencies to strengthen the global response to the climate crisis, including backing the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.
potential_concerns: The temporary nature of the office could limit its long-term impact and continuity in climate diplomacy efforts.
Coordination challenges may arise between the Climate Change Support Office and other federal agencies or international partners.
Insufficient staffing or resources could hinder the effectiveness of the office's mandate.
Critics may question the reliance on diplomatic engagement without parallel domestic climate policy advancements.
Ambiguities in the scope of the officeâ€™s responsibilities might lead to overlaps or confusion with existing State Department functions.
